image.altText: A shadow of a man walks amongst rubble

props.synopsis: The conflict between Iran and Israel has entered its eighth day, but Donald Trump believes there is now a "significant chance" of negotiations. Follow live.Â

title.children: Trump to make Iran strike call 'within two weeks', Australia shuts Tehran's embassy

image.altText: Black smoke rises over a city skyline after an explosion

props.synopsis: The federal government's decision to move diplomatic staff and their families out of Tehran comes amid growing fears about a major conflict in the region.

title.children: Fears of major conflict see Australian diplomats rushed out of Iran

image.altText: The orange glow of fire highlights dark clouds of smoke rising behind blocks of flats and other multistorey buildings.

props.synopsis: Iran has built a network of allies around the Middle East. But none of those proxies nor its most powerful backers, China and Russia, have intervened since Israel began bombing Tehran.

title.children: As Iran comes under attack, its allies near and far have been quiet

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump wearing a Make America Great Again baseball cap.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says he will give a decision on "whether or not to go" on Iran in two weeks, as he believes there is a "substantial chance of negotiations" with the Islamist regime over its nuclear program.

title.children: Trump 'unafraid to use strength' on Iran but is buying himself time

image.altText: The sun setting over parramatta

props.synopsis: The winter solstice has the least amount of incoming heat directly from sunlight. However, for nearly the whole of Australia, the coldest weather does not arrive when the days are shortest.

title.children: Seasonal lag delays coldest weather for weeks after winter solstice

image.altText: family sit in the backyard on chairs and blankets with drinks and kids on swings

props.synopsis: As more Australians rely on family to enter the housing market, the backyard of mum and dad is becoming an appealing option.Â

title.children: As property prices rise, these families are thinking outside the box

image.altText: A phone screen showing social media apps.

props.synopsis: An organisation tasked with testing the technology behind the federal government's social media ban says a preliminary report has found age verification is ready to deploy in Australia. Follow live.

title.children: Social media ban tech ready to deploy, early report finds

image.altText: Middle aged woman leaning on a tree

props.synopsis: A group of Pilbara traditional owners has written to the federal government as pressure mounts to reveal the conditions of its North West Shelf extension.

title.children: Traditional owners 'sidelined' in government's North West Shelf approval

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has fallen in early trade, after oil prices rose 3 per cent as Donald Trump considered a US attack on Iran. Follow live.

title.children: ASX drops, oil prices rise as Israel continues strikes on Iran

image.altText: An X-ray of a person's hips.

props.synopsis:
A study that claims the popular OsteoStrong program can help strengthen bones in post-menopausal women is "misleading", and "should never have been published", say bone health researchers.

Â 

Â

title.children: Study supporting 10-minute 'bone-strengthening' exercise called into question

image.altText: Frost settles at dawn in Wattle Flats New South Wales

props.synopsis: Temperatures have been plummeting in large parts of the country as we are closing in on the shortest day of the year. But during the depths of winter, which town holds bragging rights as the coldest in the country?

title.children: Australia's coldest town revealed as mercury drops sub zero for some

image.altText: A red and white plane takes off into the sky with lights in the distance

props.synopsis: India's aviation regulator had warned the airline about a number of safety issues involving other planes in its fleet before last week's fatal crash.

title.children: Air India warned about fleet's safety issues before fatal Ahmedabad crash

image.altText: Fire engulfs a large double storey home with flames leaping into the air at night.

props.synopsis: Fire Rescue Victoria says the St Georges Road home collapsed due to the intensity of the fire, which is being treated as suspicious.

title.children: Blazing fire destroys mansion in Toorak

image.altText: Transmission lines.

props.synopsis: Decisions by the Queensland government to extend the life of publicly-owned coal fired power stations beyond 2035, expand gas exploration and call in certain wind farm projects has raised concerns.

title.children: 'Energy policy chaos' in Queensland causing uncertainty among investors

image.altText: Marnus Labuschagne carries his bat, helmet and gloves

props.synopsis: Marnus Labuschagne goes from the world's top-ranked Test batter to dropped in the space of two years, after being left out of the team to face the Windies.

title.children: Labuschagne dropped for West Indies Test, as injured veteran misses out

props.synopsis: Over the AFLW off-season, Hawthorn's Tilly Lucas-Rodd underwent top surgery, a gender-affirming procedure that involves the removal of breast tissue in essentially a double mastectomy.Â

title.children: 'Huge dysphoria': First current AFLW player undergoes top surgery

image.altText: Flames rise into the air following an explosion at nighttime

props.synopsis: The company said the explosion was due to a "major anomaly", and said all personnel were safe.

title.children: SpaceX Starship rocket explodes in latest setback to Musk's Mars mission

image.altText: A woman with a 7 News microphone in front of her face.

props.synopsis: Ms Patterson's lawyer has told the jury in her triple-murder trial she emerged "unscathed" from cross-examination, as his closing address came to an end.

title.children: Erin Patterson's lawyer urges jury to reject 'convoluted' triple-murder case

image.altText: A composite photo of Victorian opposition leader John Pesutto and former Liberal MP Moira Deeming.Â

props.synopsis: The Victorian Liberal Party's administrative committee has voted to loan $1.55 million to former leader John Pesutto to pay his legal costs to MP Moira Deeming.

title.children: Victorian Liberals vote to save John Pesutto from bankruptcy

image.altText: Sussan Ley press conference smile

props.synopsis: To the extent anyone is paying attention, Sussan Ley has made a better start than many, including some Liberals, had expected.

title.children: Sussan Ley isn't dealing with the media like Peter Dutton did

image.altText: Mugshot of Robert Paul Long in 2000.

props.synopsis: Robert Paul Long was sentenced to life in prison with a non-parole period of 20 years for setting fire to the Childers Palace Backpacker Hostel on June 23, 2000.

title.children: Breaking: Childers backpacker hostel killer not being considered for parole

image.altText: Queens of the Stone Age frontman Josh Homme inside the Paris Catacombs.

props.synopsis: It's been Queens of the Stone Age frontman Josh Homme's life-long dream to become the first band to (legally) play in the Paris Catacombs. He wasn't going to let emergency surgery ruin a passion project two decades in the making.

title.children: How Josh Homme overcame illness to play for 6 million dead souls

image.altText: large, orange mushroom cloud takes up the evening sky over a woman standing outside her house

props.synopsis: From Trump's family business monetising the president's name again to a volcanic eruption affecting up to 14,000 travellers, it was another big week in news. Test yourself on what you remember.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: New Trump merchandise, a volcanic eruption and the annual G7 summit

image.altText: A smiling, dark-haired woman holds a little boy while standing in front of a house bearing many solar panels.

props.synopsis: Hundreds more homes are expected to be converted as part of the Electrify 2515 scheme, which offers subsidies to households looking to cut fossil fuel use and power bills.

title.children: Scores of homes go green amid plan to run entire postcode off renewables

image.altText: police auxilary liquor inspector uniform on man in street

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has been slammed over a plan to grant transit and public housing safety officers "quasi-policing powers", including authority to carry guns on buses, in supermarkets and public housing.

title.children: NT compared to US under Trump over plans to arm public 'quasi-police'

image.altText: A man with glasses sits with his arms crossed and resting on a grand piano.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's pre-eminent opera maestros, best known for reorchestrating the ABC's radio news theme, will soon lead the Darwin Symphony Orchestra â with grand plans to take the community ensemble to the world.

title.children: Hope is in 'short supply right now' but this man believes music can help

image.altText: Man with white hair in black sailing jacket and hat, holding frame of steam boat

props.synopsis: A Wollongong man who has spent the past six years building a 20th-century steamboat in his shed has received a huge send-off during his maiden voyage.Â

title.children: Sick of watching TV, man builds steamboat in backyard

image.altText: A brown beetle against a white background.

props.synopsis: The WA government will stop trying to eradicate an invasive beetle called the polyphagous shot-hole borer and start managing it instead. Why is this pest so dangerous, and what can be done about it?

title.children: A tiny pest has been spreading through Perth. Here's how it goes undetected

image.altText: Two men wearing sit side by side at a bar, one raising a bottle of beer in the air.

props.synopsis: Locals say the Gascoyne Junction pub is the "social hub" of the remote WA town and its reopening is bringing life back into the region.

title.children: Outback community overjoyed as pub reopens after six-month dry spell

image.altText: Hand holding a magnifying glass over Tasmanian Government letterhead.

props.synopsis: The activities of Tasmania's 70 registered lobbyists, who act on behalf of paying clients to get results from the government, were to be made public from July 1, but that's no longer going to happen.

title.children: Tasmanians were weeks away from seeing how lobbyists operate â but not anymore

image.altText: Daria Kasatkina clenches her fist

props.synopsis: Australia will host the next Billie Jean King Cup tennis tie in Tasmania, with Daria Kasatkina hoping to be on board for the first time.

title.children: Kasatkina keen on Billie Jean King Cup bow for Australia

image.altText: Daryl Mundy

props.synopsis: A driver involved in a CBD car crash with a SA Police sergeant has called for greater oversight of cases where police are under investigation.

title.children: Crash involving SA Police sergeant prompts calls for more oversight

image.altText: Dumped tyres 2

props.synopsis: Authorities have spent more than $100,000 and delayed bushfire safety work to remove hundreds of tyres illegally ditched in one of Queensland's most pristine national parks.

title.children: Anger, costly clean-up after 200 tyres dumped in national park gorge

image.altText: Cocoa farmer inspects his beans on red trays.

props.synopsis: Australian cocoa producers aren't normally the cheapest source of the sweet treat's key ingredient, but with global supply set to tighten further, chocolate makers are lining up to buy Aussie beans.

title.children: As chocolate prices surge, Aussie cocoa growers are in the sweet spot
